contentrichtext.text: [[File:Ofarim Esther 66.jpg|right|thumb|150px|Esther Ofarim, 1966]] '''Esther Ofarim''' ({{lang-he|אסתר עופרים}} ) (born June 13, 1941) is an [[Israeli Jews|Israeli]] [[singer]]. ==Biography== Esther Zaied was born in [[Safed]] to a Syrian Jewish family. In 1959, she met [[Abi Ofarim]], a guitarist and dancer, whom she later married. She began performing as a child, singing [[Hebrew]] and international [[folk song]]s. In 1960 Esther landed a small role in the [[film]] ''[[Exodus (1960 film)|Exodus]]''. In 1961 she won the Song Festival in [[Tel Aviv]], where she sang "Saëni Imchá Bemachol" (Dance with Me) and "Naamah". Two years later, she won second place in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 1963]] with "[[T'en va pas (Esther Ofarim song)|T'en vas pas]]," representing [[Switzerland]]. From then on, her [[duet (music)|duo]] with Abi Ofarim took off. In 1966 they had their first [[Chart-topper|hit]] in [[Germany]] with "Noch einen Tanz." Their greatest success in Germany was in 1967 with "[[Morning of my Life]]", which was written by the [[Bee Gees]]. In 1968 "[[Cinderella Rockefella]]" hit the top of the [[record chart|charts]] in a number of countries including the [[United Kingdom|UK]].<ref name="British Hit Singles & Albums">{{cite book | first= David | last= Roberts | year= 2006 | title= British Hit Singles & Albums | edition= 19th | publisher= Guinness World Records Limited | location= London | isbn= 1-904994-10-5 | page= 404}}</ref> They played many live concerts in [[New York City|New York]] and [[London]], and in 1969 they toured around the world. [[Image:Esther2001.jpg|thumb|150px|Esther Ofarim, Hamburg concert, 2001]] The couple divorced in Germany in 1970.<ref>[http://www.esther-ofarim.de/bildzeit1.htm Esther-ofarim.de]</ref> Esther started her solo career with several [[album]]s and [[concert]]s. In 1984 she played in [[Joshua Sobol]]'s piece "Ghetto", produced by Peter Zadek in [[Berlin]] (Germany). There she sang some songs, including "Frühling" and "Unter deinen weissen Sternen". Ofarim's songs were featured in the 2004 [[Cinema of Israel|Israeli film]], ''[[Walk on Water (film)|Walk on Water]]''. ==See also== *[[Music of Israel]] *[[Culture of Israel]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.estherofarim.com Esther's official website] {{s-start}} {{s-ach}} {{succession box | before=[[Jean Philippe]]<br>with "[[Le retour]]" | title=[[Switzerland in the Eurovision Song Contest]] | years=1963 | after=[[Anita Traversi]]<br>with "[[I miei pensieri]]" }} {{s-end}} {{Authority control|VIAF=6010228}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Ofarim, Esther | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Zaied, Esther | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 13 June 1941 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Safed]], [[Israel]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ofarim, Esther}} [[Category:1941 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Jews in Mandatory Palestine]] [[Category:Israeli Jews]] [[Category:Israeli female singers]] [[Category:Israeli musicians]] [[Category:Jewish singers]] [[Category:Swiss Eurovision Song Contest entrants]] [[Category:Eurovision Song Contest entrants of 1963]] [[Category:People from Safed]] [[Category:Syrian Jews]] [[Category:Lebanese Jews]] [[Category:Lebanese emigrants to Israel]]
